selectedDataElement.longName: Last Alive Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculated Day Value
selectedDataElement.preferredQuestionText: Number of days from initial diagnosis to date last known alive
selectedDataElement.definition: Time interval from the last day on which a person is known to be alive to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

dataElementDerivationDetails.rule:
Calculation is as follows
1.  CDEs 1,2,3 are concatenated to create one calendar date for the event referenced (Date1).
2.  CDEs 4,5,6 are concatenated to create one calendar date for initial pathologic diagnosis (Date2).
3.  Values of both dates are converted to milliseconds since the epoch (January 1, 1970)
4.  The values of date Date2 are subtracted from the values of date Date1.
5.  The remainder of the subtraction will be divided by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000).
dataElementDerivationDetails.method:
Date 1 is the concatenation of the component CDE1 to CDE2 to CDE3 to form a date in the format of DDMMYYYY.
Date 2 is the concatenation of the component CDE4 to CDE5 to CDE6 to form a date in the format of DDMMYYYY.
